scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of various records spanning 1850 to 1954 and documenting the activities of the Gray-Pyle Real Estate Company. Materials mainly include printed material relating to real estate for apartment buildings and private homes in the boroughs of Brooklyn and Queens, as well as Nassau County in Long Island. Also included are numerous public auction notices; posters and sale notices, many including maps or photographs showing lots to be offered for sale; street and lot maps; blueprints; and booklets published by real estate companies concerning apartment building complexes and neighborhoods. Additional materials include booklets describing building zone ordinances for Babylon, Long Island; legal documents; newspapers about building supplies; correspondence; and two scrapbooks with news clippings and classified advertisements for property.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn-based Gray-Pyle Real Estate Company was located at 199 Montague Street in the neighborhood of Brooklyn Heights. Founded by Howard C. Pyle and George H. Gray as Howard C. Pyle and Company in 1904, the company's name was changed to the Gray-Pyle Real Estate Company in 1919.
